column3: (Cross-Site Request Forgery is possible, but OAuth2 or JWT might be used)
(X-Content-Type-Options header missing but acceptable for APIs)
(Content Security Policy (CSP) header not set, but might be handled at the frontend proxy)
(Absence of Anti-CSRF Tokens, but API might use other protection mechanisms)
(Application Error Disclosure - may be false positive in API responses)
(Loosely Scoped Cookie - check if session cookies need path / domain restrictions)
(Cross Site Scripting (Reflected) - sanitize all user input)
(Cross Site Scripting (Persistent) - in HTTP response - sanitize output)
(Anti CSRF Tokens Scanner - implement CSRF protection)
(Format String Error - avoid user controlled format strings)
(SQL Injection - Hypersonic SQL - use parameterized queries)
(Remote OS Command Injection - sanitize system command parameters)
